lenders.occupational_info: I actively manage investments for clients using stocks, bonds, funds, CD's etc. in order to grow client resources so that they may meet their own needs and be able to be more generous in their personal stewardship.

Through KIVA we've found that giving just a little can make a big difference.  Pay it forward.
lenders.occupational_info: Scott supervises specialized piping for construction of pharmaceutical and semiconductor companies.  Gretchen works with mentally disabled young adults and has her own business, running a Duplicate Bridge Club and teaching the game to newcomers.

and now, years later, i understand the power of believing in someone, and why Jesus places so much importance on helping those who need someone to believe enough in them that they do something about it with their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: i tell people that my job is to make things pretty. i am passionate about clear communication, both visually and verbally.

lenders.name: Kwasi
lenders.loan_because: I wantto fight poverty, if you can use my money to help fight it, I will be very happy!

lenders.loan_because: I would like to give to those who are in need
lenders.occupational_info: I work with electricity. My wife teaches children in 1st grade who are 5 and 6 years old.

lenders.name: Mike & Debbie
lenders.loan_because: We enjoy seeing people's lives change when they get empowered to use the skills and enthusiasm God has given them.
lenders.occupational_info: Mike & Debbie are retired and living in the Pacific Northwest of the USA. Mike helps with marketing and print production for his clients.

lenders.name: Ryan
lenders.loan_because: Becasue God had blessed me and my family.  I want to see people succeed in this world and I want to give back. I want to help a fellow brother or sister............
lenders.occupational_info: Protection of life and property.  Keep the peace.

lenders.name: mary beth
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: Making a difference in people's lives, both inside and out.

lenders.name: Keara
lenders.loan_because: I care about people and I think that everyone deserves the chance to provide for their own family without having to rely on their government to do it for them. This is an opportunity for people to help each other reach success and then pay it forward to the next one down the line. It's a win-win situation!
lenders.occupational_info: First and foremost, I am a happily married mother of 4 amazing girls and a foster mom to an amazing son from Congo, Africa who is now living independently and making a great living for himself here in the U.S.. Although we live mostly off of my husband's income, I work as an independent agent for an international student exchange organization. I began working as an Area Representative about 4 years ago. My job is to locate and secure loving families and homes for exchange students who come to the U.S. to study and improve their opportunities for their futures. Once the students arrive, I supervise them and help them to work through the adjustments of adapting to a new culture and a new family. I take the students and families on many trips and hold many parties for them throughout the year in hopes that I can make it the best experience for everyone involved. I also direct the Foreign Exchange Ministry at my local church. It's a Ministry that was founded in order to give the exchange students and refugees in our surrounding community a chance to experience God's love first-hand just by sharing time together, experiencing community service projects together, attending church together, and reaching out to our schools and communities together. We enjoy many cultural and spiritual events and trips together through the ministry and in the end, out of over 70 students that I've had in my ministry, over half of them have found Christ and have continued a relationship with Him. Working with international students is my number one passion but my biggest dream in life is to partake in missionary work. I am hoping to save enough money to take my family on an international mission trip so that we can all begin to see how much one person can make a difference but also to help us all realize that, even in our hardest economic struggles, we are a rich society with lots to be thankful for. Working as a Representative only pays enough to offer a minimal supplemental income which I use to take my kids to movies, buy them some toys or treats that they like, visit our relatives in Chicago, and so forth. To be honest, the joy that I get from working with the kids and families is WAY more than what any paycheck could give me so I don't really mind that it doesn't pay much. I just pray that I can one day make this into something much more than what it is now. I would like to expand my ministry and help other un-diverse regions of the U.S. see the joy in understanding other cultures, races, and countries and how we're not really that much different from one another. I hope that the impact that we've made here in this tiny little town of Michigan will spread like wildfire!

lenders.name: Carla
lenders.occupational_info: SLPs diagnose and treat children and adults with communication and/or swallowing problems.

lenders.loan_because: I have spent time in several developing countries where farmers struggle to get the financing they need to improve their lives.  Most of my time is spent helping raise funds for clean water projects.
lenders.occupational_info:
I teach people how to become lawyers or advocates so that they can make the world a better place.

I am now approved ordination in the United Church of Christ, pending call (which means when I get a job).  My faith community is devoted to welcoming everyone wherever they are on the faith journey and to bringing the kingdom of God closer to earth for all, but especially the poorest of the poor.

lenders.loan_because: the money I have is from God, which I am just "holding" for Him, and He's asked me to steward it well for His Kingdom purposes. How better to share it than with my brothers and sisters across the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a non-profit that assists local families in tough situations with home repair and maintenance.

lenders.name: Rod
lenders.loan_because:
I loan because I firmly believe that the only way to make a positive long term effect on global need is to empower, train and support individuals as well as model commerce such as lending and investing, so that through different seasons of people's lives, as well as their children’s lives, they will be able to sustain and support micro economies which make up and kick start an overall economy in their part of the world. 
I also am of the belief that people just don’t want others around the world to continue to send aid which creates dependency. My belief is that most people want to support their own needs and that from a personal standpoint processes  which support areas such as micro economics is an excellent way for individuals to build self esteem as well as obtain a sense of achievement, which if and when successful will allow them to connect with others with needs and actually give true meaning to “pass it on”.
lenders.occupational_info: I work at South Ridge Community Church-A Community Church in NJ. I offer leadership in the areas of Finance, Facilities and Administration.

lenders.name: Gene
lenders.loan_because: Matthew 25:40
lenders.occupational_info: I teach, serve, and minister to middle school students.

lenders.name: Tricia

lenders.occupational_info: I am a counsellor who works to help others with emotional and mental health problems.

lenders.name: Mike

lenders.occupational_info: I work with local governments to help them decide what kind of community they want and how to make it happen.

lenders.name: Kreye Family
lenders.loan_because: We are a family on a mission to be the hands and feet of Christ in a broken world.

lenders.name: Diane
lenders.loan_because: I believe Jesus has commanded us to reach out to the poor, the widows, the orphans and this is one way to do that, that is empowering.  I believe in people helping people.  I believe in helping ohers to help themselves.

lenders.name: Amy
lenders.loan_because: God has blessed me with what I  need and more. I know that by being born in a more affluent nation I have had opportunities that I take for granted that most of the world never had. I have International friends from many countries and what always impresses me is their very diligent work ethic. I believe that God entrusted me with the blessings He has given me; not so that I can keep them for myself, but so that I can be a blessing to others.
lenders.occupational_info: I work twelve hour shifts at a   University hospital taking care of heart patients. I love having a job that lets me reach out and touch the lives of others. By investing our selves in the lives of others I believe that we ourselves are blessed. My patients have the ability to touch my heart and life and to teach me new things about myself and other people every day I work.

lenders.occupational_info: I started several oil and gas companies in the USA.  I have had to borrow funds or raise partners.  I know it is difficult.  Best of luck to you.

I provide solutions to women who have been identified as emerging leaders within their organization.  They are driven, have a high learning agility and genuinely desire to increase their effectiveness as a leader at work and in life. My clients are usually at an inflection point in their career or are experiencing a "passion shift".  
They are looking for a partner to help them overcome hurdles, differentiate their talent, and produce fulfilling results. My client portfolio includes executives, coaches, entrepreneurs, and international consultants.
